item.title: South Korea’s President Faces New Impeachment Vote
item.description: President Yoon Suk Yeol’s ruling party blocked the opposition’s first attempt a week ago after his short-lived attempt to declare martial law.

item.title: Singer Turns ‘Feliz Navidad’ Into Protest Anthem Against Yoon Suk Yeol
item.description: Baek Jae Gil, whose viral anthem calls for the ouster of President Yoon Suk Yeol, has a long history with the country’s pro-democracy movement.

item.title: Images Suggest Russia Is Packing Up Equipment in Syria
item.description: Satellite images reveal military movements that could be a possible prelude to Moscow’s withdrawal. An American found in Damascus this week was handed...

item.title: Europe Begins to Ask if Syrians Can Go Home After al-Assad’s Fall
item.description: Nearly a million Syrians in Germany alone have made new lives. But after the fall of Bashar al-Assad, some politicians across the continent have sugge...

item.title: Canada’s Gas Brings Indigenous People New Money, and Old Worries
item.description: New export terminals along the rugged Pacific coastline have reignited a generations-old debate over identity and environmental stewardship.
